intro: Borreria pumila, commonly known as the small borregaard, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid regions. Borreria pumila is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
